overviews.title: What is Aeronautical Engineering?: Fees 2026, Subjects, Top Colleges, Admissions

blocks.text: Aeronautical Engineering courses teach about the application of scientific and mathematical basics for the planning, design, construction, testing, and maintenance of aircraft and other high-end flightworthy machines, keeping in mind the safety guidelines.

It is a subcategory of Aerospace Engineering focused on both aircraft and spacecraft systems. Alongside classroom learning, you will be provided with hands-on training via lab work and projects. If interested, you can continue reading the article for more details on the Aeronautical Engineering courses.

In an Aeronautical Engineering course, you'll study Aerodynamics, Propulsion Systems, Flight Mechanics, Avionics, Materials Science , etc., subjects. You can pursue these courses at BTech, BE, MTech, ME, PhD , Diploma, and Certification levels.

Once completed a program, you can become an Aeronautical Engineer, Flight Engineer, Systems Engineer, Aircraft Designer, Propulsion Engineer , and more. You can work for various industries, including Aviation, Defense, Manufacturing, Education, etc.
If interested, you can continue reading the article for more Aeronautical Engineering course details.

faqs.question: What does Aeronautical Engineering mean?
faqs.answer: Aeronautical Engineering means designing, manufacturing and maintenance of flight machines and aircraft. It is a niche domain which is under development in our country but provides great career opportunities not only in India but in foreign nations also. It also prepares professionals to develop new technologies for the commercial aviation sector. Recruitment opportunities are available in defense services and the aviation industry. Engineering in aeronautics is taxing because of its vast syllabus which requires a lot of dedication and hard work. Know all about- Engineering courses

faqs.question: Which is better: Aeronautical Engineering vs Aerospace Engineering?
faqs.answer: Both Aerospace and Aeronautical Engineering are good branches, but if you want to make a choice between one see the difference between them. Aerospace Engineering is a rather more general field of engineering that includes the design, production and use of aircrafts, space crafts and other systems . Aerospace engineers are involved in numerous positions and different fields, whether it be in the designing of a new airplane or the creation of a new propulsion system for a spacecraft. They also deal in the installation of avionic and other systems in aircrafts and space crafts. Aerospace engineers should have a good background knowledge and understanding of mathematics, physics and engineering mechanics, aerodynamics propulsion and thermodynamics. Aeronautical Engineering is slightly more specific than aerospace engineering since it majorly deals with the construction of airplanes. Aeronautical engineers are involved in designing the specials of an aircraft, its controls, structure and power plant. They also must understand the layout of airport and other aviation related structures. Aeronautical engineers normally have a baseline preparation in arithmetic, physics and engineering mechanisms. Know more about - Engineering courses

faqs.question: Do I need prior flying experience for pursuing Aeronautical Engineering?
faqs.answer: Not at all. You do not need any prior flying experience to go for a degree in Aeronautical Engineering . The field is about the design and development aspect of aircraft and other flight-worthy vehicles and not the flying aspect per se. Pilot Training courses cover that part in depth. For Aeronautical Engineering courses, a passion for aviation in general and mechanics can be advantageous.

blocks.caption: Aeronautical Engineering Eligibility Criteria & Admission Process 2026

rows.Eligibility Requirements: The basic B.E/B Tech Aeronautical Engineering eligibility criteria is at least 50-60 percent marks in aggregate in PCM subjects in Class 12. Aeronautical Engineering courses are offered by many engineering colleges in India. The admission criteria for students are JEE Main scores, along with other state-level/university-specific entrance tests.

Students must have completed a BTech Aeronautical Engineering/ BE Aeronautical Engineering with a minimum of 55 percent marks. Many institutions of Aeronautical Engineering accept GATE scores for admission to Master’s degree in the discipline.
For diploma courses in  Aeronautical Maintenance Engineering, the basic eligibility requires students to have completed Class 10 with at least 50 percent marks in Science and Mathematics subjects.
For Doctoral programmes, candidates must have completed the Master's programme and cleared any research entrance test.

blocks.text: Aeronautical Engineering Admission Process 2026

The Aeronautical Engineering admission process is based on both merit and entrance exams. You must thoroughly go through the procedure of the colleges you are targeting. Most of the renowned colleges require entrance exam scores. Others, that provide admission on a merit basis, conduct separate rounds, like the Personal Interview, to analyze your capability.
If you want to know how to get admission in Aeronautical Engineering courses in India, you can go through the general Aero courses admission process given below.

rows.Details: First, check the eligibility criteria of the desired college and ensure fulfilling them.

Next, register on the official website of the college/exam body. After this, fill out the application form, attach the required documents, and pay the application fee to complete the application process.
Now, appear for the entrance exam (if applicable) at the given time and venue.
Students involved in the merit-based admission process may have to wait for the college to verify their application and send a confirmation email to the shortlisted candidates.
Stay updated regarding the result dates of the entrance exam and visit the official site to see the results.
Some colleges can conduct GDPI (Group Discussion or Personal Interview) rounds; be prepared.

Based on the score or rank, a student becomes eligible for counselling or admission rounds. Fill out the choice forms indicating the preferred colleges and courses, and attend the counselling session.

blocks.text: Note - The above information is taken from external sites may vary.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility to pursue Aeronautical Engineering course?
faqs.answer: If you have completed Class 12th with PCM subjects and have a minimum score of 50 to 60% in board exams , you are eligible to pursue courses in Aeronautical Engineering after 12th. Also, a keen interest in aviation, aircraft, and understanding how they fly is important for motivation and success in this business field. Problem-solving, creative and analytical skills are also highly valuable in this field. While there is no as such age limit, mostly students are between 17-21 years old when they take admission to UG level Aeronautical Engineering courses. For PG courses in Aeronautical Engg. you must secure at least 50 to 55 percent marks in BTech Aeronautical Engineering or a related field. know more about - Aeronautical Engineering Course Admission

faqs.question: What is the selection process for BTech Aeronautical Engineering course?
faqs.answer: The selection process for the B Tech Aeronautical Engineering course depends on both parameters that include the Class 12 merit and entrance test marks. Most of the Aeronautical Engg. colleges consider the marks obtained by students in relevant entrance tests and then allot a seat on the basis of their rank in the exam. Having said that, there are more than 80 BTech in Aeronautical Engineering colleges that offer merit-based admissions, looking at the Class 12 board exam marks of the students. These colleges mostly take the PI or GD rounds in such cases. Meanwhile, a few colleges also give equal weightage to both the things. So, you should check the guidelines given on the college websites to ensure a smooth admission process.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for BTech in Aeronautical Engineering?
faqs.answer: You can start with the very basic step of checking the eligibility criteria for admission to the course at popular BTech Aeronautical Engineering colleges. If the college you’re targeting offers admission on the basis of Class 12 merit, you need to get excellent marks in the board examination as the merit cutoff lists are usually high. For BTech Aeronautical Engineering admission on the basis of entrance exam scores, you need to give relevant entrance exam and secure a good rank and score to be able to get a seat for the program at some good college. Further, you have to fill out the college application forms. After the exam results are declared and you’ve got your result, you need to apply for the counselling session through the college online portal. You will be given a seat during the counselling process after which you can pay the course fee at the BTech Aeronautical Engg. college and start attending your classes. Know more about - Aeronautical Engineering courses

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application process of BTech Aeronautical Engineering?
faqs.answer: In majority of the cases, the application process for the BTech Aeronautical Engg. course takes place in the virtual mode where you have to fill a detailed application form and upload important documents for admission to the course. You can find the basic list of documents that you must keep with you while you're filling the application form given below: Class 12 th mark sheet with at least 50 to 70 percent marks in the PCM subjects Provisional Class 12 certificate (if the original is not issued yet) Class 10 th mark sheet Migration and Character Certificate (may be required) Valid identity proofs like Aadhar, Passport, PAN card, etc. Reserved category certificate (if applicable) Recent passport-size photos

blocks.text: Aeronautical Engineering Course Comparison

Whenever we talk about the idea of turning the passion for flying and travel into a full-time profession, a few popular choices that come to mind are Aeronautical Engineering, Pilot Course, and Aircraft Maintenance Engineering . Given below is a comparison table that can help you give wings to your dreams of working in the aviation industry by making the right choice.

rows.Aeronautical Engineering: Foundational aspects of aero structures, aircraft systems and instrumentation, flight mechanics and aerodynamics, jet propulsion, flight vehicle design, and aircraft stability.
rows.Pilot Course: Core concepts of air regulations, aviation meteorology, air navigation, aircraft engines and seamanship, the technical portion, and flight planning.

rows.Aeronautical Engineering: Core subjects, specialized program electives, along with practical lab work, intriguing workshops, internship programs, and a final year research project.
rows.Pilot Course: Ground school knowledge along with thorough practical sessions, including flight training and simulator training,

rows.Aeronautical Engineering: Amity University (Noida), Kalasalingam Academy of Research and Education, HITS Chennai, NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology, etc.

rows.Aeronautical Engineering: Aeronautical Engineer, Flight Engineer, Systems Engineer, Aircraft Designer, Propulsion Engineer, Testing Engineer, Avionics Engineer, etc.
rows.Pilot Course: Airline Pilots, Commercial Pilots, Fighter Pilots, Charter Pilots, etc.

rows.Aeronautical Engineering: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), ISRO, Pawan Hans, DRDO, Private Airlines, Indian Air Force, Mahindra Aerospace, etc.

faqs.question: What are the major subjects included in B.Tech Aeronautical Engineering course?
faqs.answer: Hello candidate. Some of the important subjects that form the foundational base for BTech in Aeronautical Engineering course at the best universities and colleges across India include Aircraft Structures, Propulsion Systems, Avionics and Aerodynamics, Thermodynamics, Flight Mechanics, Fluid Mechanics, Control Systems, and CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software. All of these subjects will provide you comprehensive knowledge about the working process of aircraft machinery, which will make you future ready in terms of your career in the aeronautical sector. Hope this answered your query.

faqs.question: Can I customize my Aeronautical Engineering course syllabus as per my interests?
faqs.answer: The course syllabus for Aeronautical Engg. is designed by the colleges according to the specific course level, making sure that it covers most of the fundamental aspects of the field of aeronautics. In syllabus, you need to study some compulsory core subjects in every semester , which are considered very important to get a deep understanding of the discipline. Other than the core subjects, you have the chance to opt for various elective subjects as per your own interests, something that you enjoy studying and is probably easy for you to grasp and make sense of . Overall, you will have a good time studying Aeronautical Engineering courses if you have interest in this field. Know more about - Engineering Courses

faqs.question: What all concepts are covered in Aircraft Stability and Control subject?
faqs.answer: The Aircraft Stability and Control subject is of extreme importance for every aeronautical engineering graduate because it teaches you about the various ways in which an airplane could respond after facing some unforeseen disturbances, and further gives you an idea regarding different ways to tackle the same. This information is crucial for the aeronautical engineer to put to use while designing and manufacturing the aircraft in order to install the required safety equipment and control systems in place. Know more about - Engineering Courses

faqs.question: Is the BTech Aeronautical Engineering syllabus easy?
faqs.answer: The answer to this question is very subjective. The syllabus for the BTech Aeronautical Engineering course is planned in a manner that it covers all the important aspects of the field of aeronautics and aviation so that you get an idea of the overall picture of this work field. If you have a deep interest in this field, you may find even the toughest subject the easiest one. Useful Link - Aeronautical Engineering Syllabus

faqs.question: Which job profile is better among Aircraft Design Engineer and Avionics Engineer?
faqs.answer: Neither is inherently "better". They're both different specializations - an Aircraft Design Engineer focuses on overall structure and mechanics (body, wings, engines) but an Avionics Engineer works with electronics (radar, navigation, autopilot, communication systems). Candidates should choose Aircraft Design if they love physical, mechanical and also aerodynamic aspects. Or they can choose Avionics if they are interested in computers, electronics and also complex systems that make plane "smart".

faqs.question: What is the BTech Aeronautical Engineering course duration?

blocks.text: The B Tech Aeronautical Engineering course is 4 years long where the coursework is divided into 8 semesters and you get to study some core subjects that give you the basic understanding of the field and some elective choices that you can choose yourself, something that you find interesting and easy to learn.

Most of the BTech courses are 4 years long, except for the lateral entry and integrated BTech-MTech courses. The lateral entry programme for B Tech Aeronautical Engineering has a 3-year duration and the integrated BTech-MTech course is 5 years long.

faqs.question: How can I become an Aeronautical Engineer after 12th?

blocks.text: Students who have successfully completed their class 12th examination or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics (PCM) and aggregate of at least 50 to 75% in the examination are eligible to apply for the entrance exam for Aeronautical Engineering for BTech course.
After clearing Class 12th, candidates must clear any entrance exam such as JEE Main, KCET, and HITSEEE, for seeking admission in private or government engineering college.

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility criteria for admission to BTech Aeronautical Engineering at popular Indian colleges?

blocks.text: Hello candidate, the minimum eligibility criteria for getting admission to BTech Aeronautical Engineering at popular Indian colleges is a minimum of 50-55% marks in Class 12. Further, you must have completed your Class 12 with a Science stream with 50-55% marks in PCM subjects.

Rest, for the reserved category students, there is some sort of marks relaxation in the eligibility criteria that you can check by visiting the official websites of the colleges. The admission to the course is given on a merit basis and/or entrance exam scores that may vary on the basis of the college and its individual guidelines. In addition, you may also have to appear for rounds such as Personal Interview (PI) round after getting shortlisted via the cut-off round for getting admission at some of the academic institutions.
Hope this answered your question. If yes, please up vote.

faqs.question: How can I apply for Aeronautical Engineering courses: Online or Offline?

blocks.text: Almost all of the Aeronautical engineering colleges in India release the application forms for admission in the online mode well in advance of the final exam date so that a majority of the students can apply from the comfort of their homes without having to travel to the institution. This approach promotes inclusivity and diversity. You need to upload the scanned copies of all the important documents, fill out all the important details, and pay the application fee.

Having said that, a few colleges may still follow the offline approach of filling out the admission application and submitting it at the college window. This is less likely to happen, though. Still, it is always better if you read the admission guidelines given on the college websites for better clarity.
Read more: Aeronautical Engineering Admission 2025

faqs.question: Can I get admission to BTech Aeronautical Engineering without giving the entrance test?

blocks.text: You can definitely get admission to the BTech Aeronautical Engg. course without giving the entrance exams , on the basis of the Class 12 board exam marks that is usually followed by GD or PI rounds. For Tamil Nadu students in particular, TNEA Counselling after 12 th can be a perfect entry point for admission to top BTech Aeronautical Engineering colleges.
To have a clear picture, you may check the respective college websites for their admission requirements and then prepare accordingly.

faqs.question: Can I get admission to B.Tech in Aeronautical Engineering at reputed Indian colleges on the basis of class 12th score?

blocks.text: Absolutely, yes. You can pursue the BTech Aeronautical Engg. course on the basis of Class 12 merit. There are more than 180 BTech Aeronautical Engineering colleges in India , out of which approx. 87 colleges give admission taking into account your Class 12 board exam marks. These colleges often take extra admission rounds like the GD or PI after the exam results are out. A few examples include Amity University (Noida) and Parul University (Vadodara). Having said that, a lot of top colleges in the country strictly give admission to the course on the basis of entrance test marks. So, it is always better to check the official college websites for accurate details.

faqs.question: Are CAD tools taught in Aeronautical Engineering?

blocks.text: Of course. CAD software and tools are a crucial part of the Aeronautical Engineering syllabus at top colleges, given their importance in modeling aircraft structures and propulsion systems. You design and visualize aircraft and related components through advanced CAD features. Mastery over CAD tools allow you to achieve precision and the desired safety requirements.

faqs.question: Can AI replace some roles of aeronautical engineers?

blocks.text: It is less likely to replace the aeronautical engineers completely. AI will reshape their roles , asking them to leverage AI capabilities and innovate instead of being replaced.

You can expect improved AI design and simulation, automation of various manual routine tasks, scope for predictive maintenance, better efficiency and productivity, and discovery of new lightweight aircraft materials. So aeronautical engineers are in for an exciting ride of experimentation and higher level thinking.

Aeronautical Engineering Career

faqs.question: Can Aeronautical Engineering graduates become pilots?

blocks.text: An Aeronautical Engineering degree definitely gives you a strong understanding of aircraft systems and aerodynamics but it is not sufficient for you to become a pilot. To qualify for a pilot position you need specialised flight training, a specific number of accumulated flight hours, a pilot license and to meet certain medical fitness standards.

faqs.question: Is there any entrance exam required for Aeronautical Engineering admission?

blocks.text: Courses in Aeronautical Engg. can be studied at the diploma, UG, PG, and PhD levels. Coming to the admission to BTech course in Aeronautical Engineering, a lot of colleges admit students on the basis of the marks secured by them in the Class 12 board exams. These colleges may also take other admission rounds like the PI or GD for testing the ability of the students who apply.

Meanwhile, other top Aeronautical Engineering colleges in India consider the marks secured by students in the entrance exams. To keep more options available, students may work hard and give the entrance exam.

For M.Tech in Aeronautical Engineering, the admission takes place on the basis of the GATE exam score or other PG entrance exams. In a similar manner, for PhD courses, students have to give relevant research-based entrance exams and also prepare for the interview round where they may be asked to present a research proposal.

faqs.question: Is there any marks relaxation criteria applicable for admission to BTech Aeronautical Engineering?

blocks.text: Most of the popular Indian colleges offering the BTech Aeronautical Engineering course give some sort of marks relaxation if you belong to any of the reserved categories. The relaxation in marks may vary from one college to another, but generally it is around 5%.

You should have your reserved category certificate with you at the time of admission to avail this benefit. Further, you need to upload a scanned copy of the same at the time of filling out the application form.

faqs.question: How competitive is the entrance exam for the BTech Aeronautical Engineering course?

blocks.text: The competitiveness of BTech Aeronautical Engineering entrance exams is moderate to high , depending on the particular exam that you're planning to give, either at the national, state, or college level.
In general, there is high competition for seats at top BTech in Aeronautical Engineering colleges owing to the growing demands in the aviation sector because of rising passenger traffic.

Students get to engage in lab classes, industrial research projects, and internship programs that can lead to skill enhancement and better career prospects.

faqs.question: Are there enough job opportunities for Aeronautical Engineering graduates in India?

blocks.text: Yes, there are good job opportunities for Aeronautical Engineers in India because of India's booming aviation and space sectors. It has demand in government organisations like ISRO, DRDO and HAL and also private companies but it's competitive and it requires strong skills especially for high paying roles with growth expected in defense, space and also drone tech.

You should look out for the Aeronautical Engineering coursework at the college, internship programs, training workshops, research exposure, and the placement opportunities that the college provides.

Further, top recruiters also give weightage to students from top-ranked colleges, with a decent NIRF ranking and have good industrial connections. Rest, the choice is yours. Just make sure you select the college that provides both theory-based knowledge as well as practical exposure.

faqs.question: How tough is the Aeronautical Engineering syllabus compared to other engineering branches?

blocks.text: The Aeronautical Engineering syllabus is generally considered tough in comparison to other engineering branches because of its focus on advanced level math and physics concepts, along with complex knowledge of aerodynamics, propulsion systems, fluid dynamics, and materials science, all of which could come across as overwhelming at first glance. Aeronautical Engineering coursework also demands you have interdisciplinary knowledge of mechanical, electrical and computer engineering and software proficiency.

Having said that, the difficulty level and syllabus complexity vary on the basis of individual interests, aptitude, and passion for the field. For aeronautical enthusiasts, the syllabus might not be that hard to sail through as opposed to an average student with no serious interest in the field.

blocks.text: Aeronautical engineering courses offer education on the designing, building, or revamping process of the flying objects. The admission to this course is offered at Diploma, Undergraduate, Postgraduate and PhD level. However, some online platforms are also offering admission to Aeronautical engineering online course these days. Candidates seeking admission to this course must fulfill the eligibility criteria of the particular course.  Aeronautical engineering course help in maximizing the understanding of this field, control, dynamics, in developing structural analysis, etc. Read more details pertaining to this course below.
Diploma in Aeronautical Engineering Course

This course impart education on design, manufacturing, service, and testing of aircraft. The duration of Diploma in Aeronautical Engineering Course is three years. The course is divided into six semesters each having six months. In these six semesters, candidates will go through theoretical subjects as well as practical. To apply for admission to this course, the eligibility criteria can be seen below.
Diploma in Aeronautical Engineering Course: Eligibility Criteria
Interested candidates can apply for this course if they are meeting the following conditions:

items: Candidates should have passed Class 10 from a recognized board.
They should have studied Mathematics , Science and English as main subjects.
They should have secured at least 45% marks in aggregate.

items: Basic Electrical and Electronics Engineering Lab

Fluid Mechanics and Pneumatics Aircraft Inspection and Documentation

blocks.text: BE/BTech in Aeronautical Engineering Course

This is an Undergraduate course in which admission is offered after completing Class 12 or its equivalent. BE/BTech in Aeronautical Engineering course delivers education of various fields like designing, developing, manufacturing, maintenance, servicing of the airplanes. The syllabus is divided into eight semesters in a four-year duration course. Each semester comprises different subjects that are focusd on the technical aspect of the flying objects. Apart from that, there are laboratories to provide hands on experience.
BE/BTech in Aeronautical Engineering Course: Eligibility Criteria
Candidates will the following qualification can apply for admission to this course:

items: Candidates should have passed Class 12 from a recognized board.
They should have studied Physics , Chemistry and Mathematics as main subjects.
They must have secured minimum 50% marks in aggregate.
Candidates appearing in Class 12 can also apply.

blocks.text: ME/MTech in Aeronautical Engineering Course

ME/MTech in Aeronautical Engineering is offered to the candidates possessing an undergraduate degree in Aeronautical Engineering or its equivalent. This course educates the students to use science and technology in designing and developing structural components. In addition, ME/MTech in Aeronautical Engineering course is more focused on providing students with hands on training and practical exposure than providing theoretical knowledge. It is a two-year or four semester course.
ME/MTech in Aeronautical Engineering Course: Eligibility Criteria

items: Candidates should have passed BE/BTech in Aeronautical Engineering or its equivalent from a recognized University.
They must have secured minimum 50% marks in aggregate.

PhD in Aeronautical Engineering allows highly motivated candidates to conduct research work in the field of aerospace structures, propulsion, and aerodynamic systems. In this course, candidates can use their knowledge gained while pursuing bachelor and master degree education.

syllabus.title: Aeronautical Engineering Syllabus 2026: Check Semester-wise Subjects & Syllabus

blocks.text: Aeronautical Engineering courses provide a detailed overview to the students about the design, analysis, building, and upkeeping of flightworthy machines within the boundaries of Earth’s atmosphere. The Aeronautical Engineering syllabus covered in the classes teaches students how to apply scientific, mathematical, and engineering principles to develop aircraft and related machinery.

Aeronautical Engineering falls under the very vast umbrella of Aerospace Engineering. Some of the very much important Aeronautical Engineering subjects include Aero Structures, Aircraft Systems and Instrumentation, Flight Mechanics and Aerodynamics, Jet Propulsion, Heat Transfer, Aircraft Stability and Control, Flight Testing, Aeroelasticity , and Flight Vehicle Design.

The Aeronautical Engineering syllabus covered in classes is planned out in such a manner that it includes core subjects and a variety of elective subject choices, along with practical lab work, intriguing workshops, internship programs, and a final year research project.

The Aeronautical Engineering subjects list helps students gain important skills, including analytical skills, computer and technology aptitude, mathematical and mechanical proficiency, problem-solving, teamwork, and creativity. Students can even choose a particular subject from the B Tech Aeronautical Engineering syllabus and earn a specialization at the postgraduate level, such as Aerodynamics, Flight Mechanics and Control, Propulsion, Structures, Structural Dynamics and Aeroelasticity, and Computational Mechanics.

The Aeronautical Engineering subjects vary according to the course level and the college offering the course. Interested students may read this article further to know everything about the Aeronautical Engineering semester wise syllabus.

Engineering Thermodynamics
This subject deals with the kinetic energy generation from different sources of heat and heat transfer, which are important for the effective functioning of power systems and jet propulsion.
Aircraft Systems and Instrumentation
This subject gives an overview of the different types of aircraft instruments, and avionics systems available on the aircraft and their functions.
Flight Mechanics
Students get to learn about various practical concepts related to aircraft motion, flight control systems, flight instruments and navigation systems.
Aircraft Stability and Control
This subject teaches students about the static and dynamic stability of aircraft in general, control system architectures, and aircraft behavior.
Aero Structures
This subject primarily focuses on the structural and the functional behavior of aircraft structures just to ensure the safety of flight passengers.

career.title: Aeronautical Engineering Career Guide: Roles, Salary & Future Scope
intro: Aeronautical engineers use their artistic skills to design and build airplanes that take people places and curate every step for a successful flight defying gravity. At the forefront of this technology lies an impeccable science of Aeronautical Engineering in India driving students towards learning design, construction, and maintenance of aircraft and other missile systems.

The primary job of an Aeronautical Engineer is to devise aircraft and propulsion systems, but with time, the engineer is given many more responsibilities to carry out, such as testing aircraft systems and their maintenance. Aeronautical Engineering career in India can prove to be extremely promising for students after they complete their Aeronautical Engineering course .

Popular Aeronautical Engineering jobs for freshers include Aerodynamics Engineer, Avionics Engineer, Propulsion Engineer, Flight Test Engineer, Missile Systems Engineer, Aeronautical Research Scientist, etc . There are a plethora of job opportunities for aeronautical engineers in India with decent salary packages being offered by top recruiters in the country . The average Aeronautical Engineering salary in India is approximately INR 11 LPA, which varies on the basis of experience, skill set, and academic qualification.

table.text: Students must have secured at least 60% marks in Class 10 & Class 12 and 60% in PCM for the Non-sponsored category. Eligibility will be relaxed by 5% for the Sponsored category. The total percentage will be calculated on the basis of marks scored in English & three academic subjects (excluding second language, Physical Education, Fine Arts, Performing Arts or any other Vocational /Non-Written subjects). Students must have passed all the subjects of Class 12 from a recognized board.
Kalasalingam Academy of Research and Education

Students must have passed Class 12 from a recognized board with at least 45% marks in Physics , Chemistry, and Mathematics subjects. The entrance exams accepted for admission include JEE Main and KUEE (Kalasalingam University Entrance Exam).
Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST), Thiruvananthapuram
MTech in Aerodynamics and Flight Mechanics

Students must have completed a B.Tech or equivalent degree in Aerospace Engineering , Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Chemical Engineering. A valid GATE Score in Aerospace Engineering/Mechanical Engineering or Chemical Engineering . Only Indian citizens are eligible to apply.

Students must have completed Class 12 with at least 45% marks (40% for SC/ST) with Physics and Mathematics as mandatory subjects, along with Chemistry/Electronics/Computer Science as one of the subjects. Students must score well in any of the entrance exams, including JET, JEE Main, Uni-GAUGE, and COMEDK UGET.
Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science (HITS), Chennai

Students must have completed Class 12 with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry /Bio-Technology /Biology/Technical Vocational subject and obtained at least 50% marks (45% in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the above subjects taken together with minimum 60% in Mathematics. Students must score really well in HITSEEE (Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science Engineering Entrance Exam).

Students must have secured at least 50% marks in B.E./ B.Tech (Aerospace /Civil /Mechanical / Mechatronics Engineering ) or M.Sc. (Physics / Electronics / Computer Science / Information Technology ) and clear relevant entrance exams like GATE.
NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology, Bangalore
Students must have passed Class 10 with at least 35 to 50% marks in the final examination. They must also have studied Science and Mathematics subjects.

Students must have passed Class 12 or equivalent examination with not less than 50% marks in aggregate in the optional subjects of Physics, Mathematics and any one of Chemistry / Biotechnology / Biology / Computer Science / Electronics, with English as one of the languages of study. Students should also qualify in the NITTE University Common Admission Test (NUCAT) 2025 for BTech. Candidates appearing for Class 12 examination are eligible to apply for NUCAT. However, he/she should have completed 17 years of age as on 31st December of the year of admission.

Students must have completed a master’s degree in Aeronautical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field with at least 55% marks. A valid score in GATE or PGCET (Post Graduate Common Entrance Test) is also required for admission.

content.text: Candidates can see the syllabus below:

table.text: The JEE Main syllabus revolves around three core subjects from Class 11 and Class 12: Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Each subject will have two sections, sections A and B. Section A will have multiple-choice questions (MCQs) and Section B will contain numerical value questions. In Section B, students have to attempt any five questions out of 10, and there is no negative marking for Section B.

MHT CET exam is of 300 marks which consists of Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics/Biology of 100 marks each. It gives 20% weightage to the syllabus of Class 11 whereas 80% weightage to Class 12th syllabus. Therefore, its syllabus is slightly different from JEE Main with respect to the weightage of both exams.

Similar to the syllabus of JEE Main, COMEDK UGET consists of three sections, Chemistry and Biology. Each section consists of 60 questions carrying 1 mark each. Some of the important mark fetching areas are Calculus and 3D Geometry for Mathematics, Organic Chemistry and Electrochemistry for Chemistry and Thermodynamics, and Current for Physics

The KEAM syllabus comprises all three subjects Physics Chemistry & Mathematics. KEAM syllabus is based on class 11 and 12 examinations. The weightage of the subjects in KEAM will be 5:3:2 in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry.

The syllabus for GATE varies across various disciplines and topics such as Verbal Ability and Numerical Ability are the common topics for all papers. Moreover, the syllabus for various specialisations is of graduation-level and candidates ability to solve reasoning and numerical questions are also tested through this examination.

highly_Paid.title: Why is Engineering Still a Highly Paid Career Stream?
highly_Paid.summary: Engineering is such a field that offers the highest-paying jobs all over the world. This can be due to factors such as the ever-evolving technology industry, the wide range of engineering disciplines, and the never-ending need for skilled professionals.

paragraphs.text: Engineering as a career is very lucrative. Let us check why this is so and what makes engineering career so popular still today.
Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream Engineering is still a highly paid career stream in India and worldwide because of simple phenomenon called “supply versus demand” . The relentless advancement of technology has fueled demand for engineers across industries. Against this, number of skilled professionals always falls short of demand, creating a competitive market that drives up salaries. Many other factors lead to  sprouting of engineering careers that are very lucrative.

images.alt: Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream
images.caption: Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

images.alt: Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

paragraphs.text: To get into field of engineering , a student can start by selecting science or IT & software as their subject preference in higher education. Thereafter, they can apply for admission in top engineering colleges in India like IITs, NITs and IIITs. Apart from IITs, NITs and IIITs, many other colleges provide great engineering education, like BITS Pilani, VIT, Amrita University, SRMIST, Jadavpur University, and many more.

The degree that leads candidates to land a career in Engineering is BTech / BE . Further candidates can also pursue Master's with MTech / ME degree. The scope of research is also immense in engineering with a PhD in engineering.

heading.text: 10 Reasons Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

paragraphs.text: Let's understand why engineering is so lucrative all over globe more than any other profession. Further, we will also discuss which engineering professions are most in demand and are highly paid.
There are several reasons why engineering is a highly paid career option, like:
